Review Contents: I have owned many headsets over the years, usually top of the line Sony's, Sennheiser's, etc.  This is the best sound, I have ever heard.  I was a little skeptical at first, because Sennheiser, has not been known for it's great bass sound.  But these are not your Daddy's Sennheiser's.  I'm 79 years of age, and these babies are, MINE!Follow Up:  About 6 months after purchase the headphones started cutting in and out.  The location of the base is about 10 to 12 feet in front of me.I have tried moving the base.  Changing the re-charging batteries, switching to regular batteries, adjusting the volume on my TV, opening and closing them around my ears.  Nothing works.  The earphones haven't been abused, I am elderly and use them every evening for about two hours. Then they go back on the cradle.  For over two hundred dollars, they should last more than a year, wouldn't you think?
Title: I should have waited before writing review

Review Contents: I went with the RS 165 RF because of my frustration with the competitor's TV Ears remote headphones.  I had two sets of TV Ears and both of them broke and fell apart in less than one year or usage.  I wanted a more durable and reliable product so I went with the RS 165 RF.The RS 165 RS headphones not only continue to perform well after 7 weeks of use but have actually exceeded my expectations.  The sound quality is vastly superior to lower cost competitors such as TV Ears.  They appear to be solidly built and I expect that they will be very durable but the trade off is that they are just very slightly heavy and block out environmental noise so I have to take them off to hear what is going on in the room around me.  That is both a bane and a blessing at the same time.The instructions could be better.  One other reviewer complained that he couldn't get them to turn on. That could be because there is a universal power switch symbol on the charging station that looks like a power switch but is actually just a power indicator.  In my opinion, the designers should have used some other symbol (perhaps a lightning bolt symbol) for this indicator.  I shared the other reviewer's difficulty until I discovered that the real power switch is on the headphones themselves.  The power switch is rather small and not obvious.  Once I figured this out, everything worked well and I am very pleased with the product.  The only reason that I didn't give it a 5 Star rating is because of the poor instructions on how to turn on the phones.  I would recommend this product to those consumers that want a more durable and higher quality product than TV Ears.
Title: The sound quality is vastly superior to lower cost competitors such as TV Ears

Review Contents: Negative1) These wireless headphones, Sennheiser RS 165 RF, Totally block out someone trying to talk to you. Totally frustrating my wife!!2) They are also Hot on my ears after wearing them for awhile!3) The adjustable head band is made is just like my old Sennheiser  RS 120. After 3 1/2 years, the plastic areas that hold the spring steel band in place, started breaking. I first glued these 4 areas, then Duct Tapped them when they cracked again,  to be able to wear the headset.4) The sound input jack is a single,  3.5 mm stereo jack. In order to hook this headset into my Dennon AV Receiver, I had to buy a Y adapter to convert this hookup to dual left/right RCA plugs, something to be aware of!5) The power button is flush and hard to find while you're wearing these, also you have to hold the button down for 2 seconds. It doesn't instantly power up!Positives The sound quality is excelent, Cristal clear voices and no background static. Decent music quality with reasonable bass levels. Even with the Bass boost selected, it's not a Strong thumping bass, better for your eardrums, since they seal tightly around your ears!  Except for the Hot ears, these are fairly comfortable.* Bottom line, for me, I don't like the almost total isolation these headphones have. Even with the sound turned off, I can barely hear people around me and,  how hot my ears get after wearing them a while! Also I'm guessing the adjustable  headband will break after about 3 1/2 years since it's stress points are made exactly like my old RS 120! For the price, that's totally unacceptable!I'm selling these and  buying a replacement for my old set, Sennheiser RS 120. ($59.98) They don't sound quite as good, but much more comfortable and less isolated, AND MUCH less expensive than the current price for these.  Wow! The RS 165 today is $219.00!
Title: TOTALLY blocks out anyone trying to talk to you!

Review Contents: After almost 20 years of use, I had to replace an early Sennheiser model that was closer to the RS line of headphones.  I tried the Newer RS 120, deciding I didn't need the surround sound function, but it was over ear, which I didn't like.  Researched and choose these headphone based on reviews and features.  Price was fine.  I like this headphones much better than my original ones.  The cup of the earphone fits nicer and the sound is great.  I mostly use it for TV and Movie watching when house need to be quiet.  I've listed to some streaming music with them and the sound is pretty good.  Distance is ok, within sight, I've tried to walk outside, but once I'm away from the closest window, I loose the signal.  I was just testing, I don't really care to walk around outside with my headphones anyway, but within the house I can go just about anywhere.  I don't use the bass boost for TV or movies, I might turn it on when listening to music, but that's about it.  It ok, but I've heard better bass boost. It more like a low shelf boost than others.One other thing I like;  My hearing is going and I find myself reading the subtitles more and leaving them on.  Some older movies I stream don't have subtitles and these headphone make it so I don't miss them. I can hear dialog clearly.
Title: Great set of Wireless headphones

Review Contents: I do transcription for a living and need good reliable headphones in order to do my job.  The quality of the sound is excellent, absolutely no background noise.  They do have to stay at least a couple feet from my wireless router otherwise I get a little feedback and I do receive a little bit of interference during a thunderstorm.I am sold on Sennheiser products.  I have other systems in my house and receive the same excellent quality for all.  I would highly recommend them.
Title: I love Sennheiser!

Review Contents: I have had the older RS120 on our bedroom TV for years, but moved them to the gym so I could hear the TV above the treadmill. I have one good ear. I picked these as the replacement for the bedroom TV.  I had no need for fancy features so this would be as good or better than the "just fine" old RS120. I was delighted once the night-long required wait for the initial battery charge was completed. The sound is outstanding, even for my "bad" ear. They are very comfortable. Volume and tone are great. My only minor complaint is that they give you four or five international wall charger adapter plugs that no one in the US needs. No one travels with this rig unless they still use a steamer trunk. A waste of product and money. I tossed them in the garbage. YET they do NOT give you the 3.5 miniature phono plug to RCA male plugs conversion cord that most of us need, or at least many of us. Dumb!  Happily, I have had a drawer full of old stereo cable stuff and I actually found one  These should be included, and skip the useless international outlet adapters
Title: Music to My One Good Ear (and for the Bad One, as well)

Review Contents: I had hoped to find something similar at a lesser price but settled on these and am quite happy with them.  The RF design is trouble proof and the range is excellent.  The charge tower is simple and convenient.  They are more comfortable than I expected, not too tight and sit well.  I will not comment on the sound quality other than to speculate that any closed back design suffers flaws but my objective was to block out external noise, as such these sound good to me as long as you don't saturate them with too much low frequency bass.  I expect the open back 180 series sounds better but can't achieve the isolation these do.  In any case I find them high quality, convenient and comfortable.  Note that these 165s only have a single RCA jack input, no digital optical, but that was all I required.
Title: They Deliver on Build Quality, Convenience, Comfort and Range.

Review Contents: I needed  a set of headphones to use exclusively with the television.  Either it’s late night and I can’t turn up the sound for fear of waking someone, or there was a lot of other noise in the house and  I had to turn it up to hear all the dialogue clearly.The connection that I used was TV digital audio out -> D/A Converter -> dedicated headphones. My current analog output goes to an amplifier for running through the big stereo speakers and I wanted to keep the two independent. Originally, someone recommended that I buy a Bluetooth transmitter and then buy a pair of Bluetooth headphones where there are more options. I tried this but the Bluetooth adapter wouldn’t connect to the headphones, and when I tried the headphones, they didn’t Isolate very well and the sound was mediocre. Plus this rig was more money than the Sennheisers. So I sent that stuff back and bought the Sennheisers.My main concern was the quality of sound. I heard some wireless headphones many years ago and they sounded like crap. Like AM radio with all the hiss, etc. I own several pairs of headphones for music listening and some of them exceed $1000 in price. So I’m pretty picky and my expectations were high.Do these sound like really expensive headphones? No. but they sound pretty darn good and there was ZERO background noise. I could hear all the low level details, and on one movie there were low level background noises that I actually thought for a moment were coming from my kitchen. My main complaint about the sound is that the top end is rolled off slightly so it doesn’t show the details with cymbals or other high frequency sounds. This would be a deal killer for me if they were for music, but for television and movies it’s not a big deal.I find the comfort to be very good. I think my head is pretty average sized and they fit well. They isolate external noises pretty well also. Some have complained that the headband could use a little more padding but I don’t have a problem with it.Two minor annoyances…First, Sennheiser should have included an RCA to mini cable. This will be used more than a mini-to-mini connection (in which they include a cable) but RCA to Mini cables can be bought for less than $1 in bulk. There is no good reason why Sennheiser couldn’t have included this. The other issue is the ergonomics of the volume up/down buttons.  I’m not blind so Braille isn’t really my thing. The raised “+” and “-“ on the headset take some getting used to. A competent human factors team could have come up with a design that’s more intuitive.I didn’t find the bass boost to be of much value. I don’t think the headphones are bass deficient, and the effect of the boost is a little unnatural. You don’t need it. A better approach would have been to make it a “loudness” button which along with a little bass would boost the highs a little also. Loudness is beneficial at lower listening levels if it’s implemented properly.I thought it was a nice choice for Sennheiser to use rechargeable AAA batteries in the headset. I hate when companies use some obscure battery that’s hard to replace. This isn’t the case here. Also the manual recommends an initial charge of something like 14hrs. (going from memory) But I just pulled the batteries out and put them in my other battery charger for 2 hours and they were fully charged, so I could use the headset the same evening.  I have yet to run these down mid viewing, including watching television for 6+ hours.So although not perfect, this headset is still a really solid 4 star recommendation.
Title: For TV audio....You can't go wrong

Review Contents: I was saving up for the RS 195 and further study convinced me the only differencewas fake surround sound and an optical input.  I can do without those!  I should havepaid further attention to the specs.The 165 has one third the range of the higher priced models.  It says that clearly onthe pages of the full sized (Firefox on the PC), but not so clear on the smart phoneapp.  My bad.  I'll keep them as they work fine in the listening area and even into thecan.  If I head  toward my man cave, I only get down the 3 steps into the lower areaof the house and this is 35 feet from the base!  To be fair, the specs say 100 feet"Line of Sight".  My 35 feet is through about 4 walls and the washer/dryer when Iturn and look back from the drop out area.  I suspect others having trouble 15 feetaway have the unit very near a router or other transmitting device.  My WiFi is inthe other end of the house.  In my shop about 50 feet distant, I can sorta get a signalif I hold my mouth right, but I've never been very good at that.  They're relegated tothe living room....The good:  They fit great and are comfortable.  Compared to my old HDR 120's a worldof difference.  They stay on my head and do not tend to fall into the commode, forinstance.  That was always annoying with the 120's.  Noise is blocked out as I desired.the wife can yell at the cat or talk on the phone without annoying Mozart or the TV.Sound is clear, uncolored and pleasant.  There is amply volume available (much morethan you'll safely use).  The Bass Boost ads very subtle body to the sound withoutbeing over powering.I connect to the analog audio out of the Dish receiver and with a switch also to thestereo receiver recorder ouputs.  It takes adapters to do this.  If you are connectingto an earphone level output, you are on your own.  At line level, they work great.
Title: Warning! Much less range than the higher priced units.

Review Contents: I'm 65 yrs old and wear older hearing aids for mod - severe hearing loss.  I've used Sony's headphones for about 3 years and neither of the 2 pairs lasted much over a year.  The ear ups on then Sony phones were pretty shallow and allowed the speaker casings to touch my hearing aids causing a lot of quality issues.  I bought the Sennheiser RS165 RF for only a few dollars more as a replacement. What I've experienced is1.  The ear cups are deeper and comfortable (solves feedback and distortion issues).2.  I've gained an in set volume control (super convenient and produces a higher volume than Sony)3.  A base boost button on the head set (great for when you want to amp up the bass a touch)4.  The overall quality has been vastly improved for this first month I've been using themI've seen a couple of folks complain about the headset being a little difficult to get back on the base/recharger.  I haven't been able to find a set that will take itself off your head and remount it on the charger perfectly every time.  These shaky 65 year old hands manage this task very well.
Title: Great product at this price

Review Contents: After a mere six months of daily use, the sound frequently drops out making them very annoying and virtually unusable.  My batteries are charged an the distance to the transmitter is 5 to 7 feet.  I have been a loyal fan of Sennheiser wireless headphones for over fifteen years and have  had no reliability issues up to now.  This is my third pair of wireless Sennheisers.  They were fine when I bought them, but they are junk probably headed for the trash now.  Too bad, since Sennheiser has always been a good brand.
Title: Signal drops even at short distances

Review Contents: Very poor range. The old unit, 160, i could go anywhere in the house & all around outside the house. With this new unit, I can't even go to the next room with out loosing most of the words. This one added an automatic noise reduction that fades out the sound about every 1 sec out of every 5 sec when about 25 or more feet away. Ridiculous. Going back soon!!
Title: Very poor range. Sound fades out 20% of time when 25ft away!

Review Contents: Pros:The packaging was really great not hard to open.The product is very comfortable to use for extended periods of time.The charging atation is very convenient and easy to use.The range goes really far im in a 3000, sq ft home (2 levels) and the unit delivers great clarity throught wntire home.The audio quality and volume level is really great goes very loud and has perfect balance on base and trebble.Unit has option to give you more base with the press of a button on the headset best I've heard.Cons:if u have an older tv like me where it doesnt have a audio jack you will get some intermittent pauses sometimes it gets really annoying as it happens very frequent.Because of said lack of audio jack the unit will have minor interference when in close proximity to unit.The unit does not have a channel search for seeking clerer reception bad if u have multiple same band units in the same room (Minor interference but not somwthing one cant live without.
Title: Great product to use on Newer tv's

Review Contents: These are fairly comfortable and seem to have a good signal strength. I bought a "refurbished" one and it came with bad batteries that would not hold a charge. The seller wanted me to send back everything for them to replace the batteries and it seemed like the only winner there was the shipping company, so I just ate the expense and put in two of my own rechargeables. I was a little disappointed that they would not just send me replacements, but not enough to make them waste time and money shipping everything. The sound is good, but the fact that they didn't throw in fresh batteries has me dining them a star from the 4 it would have been.
Title: Very nice.

Review Contents: Two things that other reviewers have said are true:  Unless your sound source takes a 3.5 mm pin connector, you will have to buy the proper connector and/or cable.  The converter connector shown in the manual (3.5 to 1/4") is not provided; nor is a split "Y" RCA cable.  It's surprising that at least one type of adapter is not provided, since they do include 4 different types of electric socket plug adapters!The other minor annoyance is that the headset is tight, presumably for people who have larger head sizes.  I wear a 7-1/2 hat size, and the phones are a tad too snug, especially after an hour or so of use.  The tension will probably relax after continued use.  I may attempt to stretch them out a little, even though the "safety" manual advises against it.The phones themselves are very good.  Good sound quality, and easy to adjust.  I use them with a television with speakers hooked up via a tuner.  So the phones required a head phone jack.
Title: Good quality - may need connector/adapter

Review Contents: As an audio professional I am disappointed with the audio quality, but for the price the Sennheiser RS165's are sufficient for our purpose. We are using the RS 165's as monitors while shooting handheld live music video. The headphones have a good fit and finish, are comfortable to wear, but sound hollow compared to our Audio-Technica ATHM50 and Sony MDR7506 headphones. For listening pleasure, these RS 165's would be my last choice. Also, these brand new Sennheiser RS 165's came with a bad mini-jack cable which caused a severe Left/Right imbalance--a quick change of the mini-jack cable fixed the imbalance, but I would expect better QC from Sennheiser. In closing, we did try a few wireless headphone systems in this price range and these were the best, but don't expect "hifi" audio.
Title: These are convenient for our application, but not the best sounding headphones in our collection.

Review Contents: This is for my wife to listen to the news while I read.  We had the Sennheiser RS 160 for several years.  It was fine but finally died.  The RS 165 seems to be a far better unit.  The 160 needed a lot of care and coaxing to keep working.  The 165 keeps the batteries fully charged and automatically connects with the transmitter, something the 160 didn't do.
Title: Good wireless headphones.

Review Contents: On the very positive side, great at blocking out the audio from the TV (as others in the room are watching it too) so there is no echo effect from the headset being out of sync with the TV. On the negative side, the range from the base is limited, so I cannot do outside chores with the headset on as I could with my prior headset. Also a little uncomfortable after about an hour of use. Pressure on the top of my head.
Title: Nice sound quality but a couple of negatives.

Review Contents: I'm not an audiophile, but I really like the sound this headphone delivers.  Really clear and balanced, with enough bass.  Great for music or watching movies.  The charger is built into the stand, so that if you put the headphone in its place after using it, it should remain charged all the time.  Uses standard batteries, so its easy and cheap to switch them out once they wear out.  Definitely worth the little bit extra I paid for these over some of the other options out there.
Title: Sound great

Review Contents: I have reduced hearing in my "senior years", but still like to listen to the  music I used to hear through speaker systems. Now the sound level required for me would make it unbearable for my wife. These are a perfect solution. With this set of headphones I can listen to my hearts content without driving my wife out of the house. The only problem I had was figuring out what kind of audio adapter I need to make it fit my old receiver. The headset is comfortable enough, but not super comfortable. The listening experience satisfies my requirements and I cannot comment on frequency range quality, my ears are not that good.
Title: Just what I needed

Review Contents: These are without a doubt the best headphones I have ever owned. They are comfortable for hours on end. They have an incredible sound and do a good job at noise cancellation. I bought them to watch TV at night while the kids slept and my wife read. I bought my wife some Sony earphones with extra bass and she didn't want them after putting these on. I can hear every sound the shows and movies intend for you to hear without having to strain. The bass in these headphones is out of this world. If you don't like all the bass you can turn that down as well. And I love the fact they are wireless. Well worth the money spent.
Title: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!

Review Contents: Happy with the purchase and product works just fine.My only complaint is with the ear comfort of the headphones. After wearing the head set for approx an hour it gets a little uncomfortable and needs to be adjusted on the head.
Title: Happy with the purchase and product works just fine

Review Contents: These were a gift to my husband.  He says they are fantastic.  He says he can hear so much better than with an old pair he had been using.  He wears hearing aids and says he can keep those in while using this RS165RF system.  He also said they are very comfortable on his head and the ear pieces don't hurt his ears after using them for several hours.  A good buy!!
Title: Hubby Loves Them

Review Contents: If you are looking for headphones that are comfortable to wear  and clear sounding, these are the ones you will enjoy I can't get over the clarity that these Headphones produce.. I use them while watching TV . Before I had to have the TV volume high and my wife complained. Now even with the volume way down as she likes it, al I  have to do is  push a button on the side of the ear phone where you can raise or lower the volume or bass.to my comfort level without bothering anyone.  Follow the easy directions for connecting to your TV.. They are well worth the price.
Title: Headphones that make sound better.

Review Contents: Bought these for my Dad who has been using Sony RF headphones for close to 20 years, the sound difference between them is night and day! As they should be since they're replacing some pretty old headphones. The frequency response is great, they're comfortable and the build quality is pretty nice as well. The only thing I can complain about is that they're pretty expensive, but it's a Sennheiser product so you get what you pay for.
Title: Awesome RF Headphones

Review Contents: Back towards the end of the 90's Sony had a wireless headset I connected to my wide screen projection TV. Ancient, I know.But..  With this headset I was able to hear a singing artist actually inhale a breath. The clarity was totally,absolutely incredible. I had hoped the Sennheiser was similar but not so. Never since have I experienced that Sony effect. The Sennheiser is OK but I will continue with my search for the Sony headset. This was done on a normal TV analog audio connected to a tv dvr receiver.
Title: Memories

Review Contents: We bought one for a brother in law whose hearing problems had caused him to stop watching most movies on TV because he couldn't understand what was being said.  He's in his 80s and we weren't sure he would take to the headphones, but once he tried them and heard the difference he was sold.  He loves them and is watching movies again.  We had them sent here first (he lives in a different state) so we could try them out before giving them to him.  One of us liked them so much we ordered a second one for us.  It is working as well as the other one, and really does make a difference.  They are expensive but these are top quality headphones.  Before we bought these we ordered a cheaper one from Sharper Image and had to send It back.
Title: Works so well we ordered a second one.

Review Contents: I bought these for my husband as a gift, and he loves them. The baby and I also love that he can wear them to watch loud TV shows when we are asleep. They can be stored unobtrusively near our TV when not in use.
Title: great gift

Review Contents: Startling cheap quality!  I have a pair of Sennheiser wired TV earbuds $37 that totally blow these away for sound quality!!!  Amazingly high priced, and everything is super cheap icky looking plastic. Don't fall a sleep and roll over on these!  After using a couple hours, started cutting out about every 15 sec non stop.  Only positive thing worth noting was the nifty packaging.  Might have to go back to wired, and get another pair of HyperX.
Title: Value should be about $59.

Review Contents: really great for a person like me like a hearing loss for TV.  It is somewhat heavy and a little uncomfortable, but probably no more than any other.I marked the earphones for High Vol and Low with tiny, built-up strips of white plastic tape..can feel the dividing line between them and can adjust the vol without take off the ear phones.  It took a little practice, but worth it.  Love this birthday gift.
Title: really great for a person like me like a hearing loss ...

Review Contents: We have another set of these, they are super.  However, one would think they could include the adapter needed (even if the price increased) so on e does not have to run off to best buy.  They do include adapters for overseas use which the odds are most people do not need.
Title: Extra trip

Review Contents: Living with tinnitus, it is difficult to hear dialog on tv. The headphones help separate the voices from the background noise and music. Doesn't eliminate the tinnitus, but allows me to enjoy a show without "lip-reading".  The only con for me is that they are heavy. They are comfortable, otherwise, and definitely cancel out noise.
Title: but allows me to enjoy a show without "lip-reading"

Review Contents: Excellent sound from these wireless headphones. Like the fact they can use standard alkaline batteries while rechargeable are being charged. Excellent range, can hear sound as I wander around the house.I wear hearing aids and have trouble finding the right instruments so I could hear sound from computer or monitor. These headphones are the best I have tried. Hear many sounds i previously was unable to. Very clear sound reproduction, now I don't miss anything.
Title: Great sound, fit is very comfortable and range is extensive.

Review Contents: The sound quality is excellent, and the controls are simpler and better designed than on the earlier RS 120 and RS 140. But the price is steep and the connection doesn't carry much beyond 20 feet, especially with walls or plumbing in between.
Title: Great sound but mobility is very limited.

Review Contents: Bought for mom to watch tv (she has hearing issues), but she won't use it so I took them home.  Great for watching tv without disturbing the roomate.  Good range on signal, I can walk into other rooms and still listen to program
Title: Great sound, good range

Review Contents: You'll love this quality, comfortable, reliable, BlueTooth headset.  I bought two 5 months ago and haven't regretted the purchase.  I live in a smallish apartment and can watch TV or listen to the audio system without disturbing anyone.  There is a bass enhancement button and the headset mimicks surround sound.  The stand is also a recharger: very functional.I highly recommend the Sennheiser RS 165 RF especially for apartments or the bedroom (if you or significant other is a night owl and the other isn't!).  Only downside, the price is high for the two-headset version (over $300 US), but well worth it!
Title: You'll love this quality

Review Contents: They fit snugly, and maybe a little tighter than I would like for extended wear.  Sound quality is terrific.  Sound range was a small disappointment.  Shorter than my older, earlier Sennheisers.  I like the on/off arrangement better with this pair, as you don't have to remember to switch them off when putting them back on the stand.  And the stand arrangement is more compact and docks well.
Title: Great sound, on/off features.  Snug fit, and excellent noise cancellation.  Sound range shorter than expected.

Review Contents: My husband loves football and I hate the noise, so I bought him these headphones for his birthday. HELOVES the headphones and I also love them since our home is now a quiet place once again.  Slightly hard of hearing, he can clearly decipher the words spoken by the British actors on the BBC and as a result, he can also enjoy these programs.  One of the best gifts ever!
Title: My husband loves football and I hate the noise

Review Contents: Headset works great. Have purchased three other Sennheisers similar to this model. We like the product; this model provides quality sound and the volume adjustment is easier than on previous versions.
Title: Headset works great. Have purchased three other Sennheisers similar to this ...

Review Contents: I was having trouble with the previous headset because the ear pieces were too small and hurt my ears. This set completely covers my earsand the sound volume is easily adjustable. Just press a button on the headset to increase or decrease the sound level.
Title: This set completely covers my ears and the sound volume is easily adjustable. Just press a button on the headset ...

The plug I am referring to is the plug that goes into your TV. Had to run to the store to buy an RCA type adapter for 4 bucks. At that price, I don't get why rhey don't just provide one. Title: Count on running to the store to buy $4 adapter

Review Contents: Easy to hook up. Sound is good and fit is comfortable. I do get a few drop outs every so often, but I think it's because the sending unit is right next to my networking gear. It's not nearly as finicky as my Bluetooth headset. Unfortunately I can't test my drop out theory, because there's no other configuration I can use. But overall this is a good headphone system and lets me listen to music or my TV late at night without bothering anyone else. It also lets me hear and understand dialog on the TV clearly.
Title: Good alternative to Bluetooth

Review Contents: The headphones are quite pricey, but are very comfortable and cancel out a lot of background noise.  The volume is adjustable and the range is very good.  I have very good reception all over the house.The only complaint I have is that it seems to occasionally interfere with my remote controls when selecting different channels on my Roku streaming device.
Title: but are very comfortable and cancel out a lot of background noise

Review Contents: Great sound quality, battery has never died on me (3+ hours consecutive use) and though I only have a 1,100 sq ft home, I never lose signal. . . TOTALLY recommend this.
Title: Excells in Three Aspects

Review Contents: I have two complaints.1: the plasticy fake leather that sennheiser and other companies use for ear pads is pretty uncomfortable. These replaced some other sennheiser headphones that have the nicer fuzzy earpads. That same fuzzy earpad style is available on the RS 185. You can buy replacement pads for the 185 and they fit the 165 perfectly. I did this and couldn't be happier with the comfort of the headphones.2: The battery charges so slowly. It takes hours. I'd love if I could charge a second set of batteries in the transmitter while using the  headphones.
Title: GREAT! With two drawbacks

Review Contents: So far the RS 165 RF headphones are working Great! I can move around the whole house and still have clear reception even upstairs. The best part is my Wife does not have to listen to my "Boring TV Shows" any longer. I can watch a movie without her having the volume turned up so I can hear!  Quality built and comfortable to wear.
Title: So far the RS 165 RF headphones are working Great! I can move around the whole house and ...

Review Contents: I thought I paid a little extra so I wouldn't have to buy anything else.  But, I had to buy the cables!  But, oh my goodness, the clear sound is absolutely WONDERFUL! Review Contents: I waited a few months to review this because of some of the negative reviews. This is my personal and unpaid review. The sound quality is fantastic. The clarity is fantastic. I can hear dialog better than ever. No need for closed captions anymore. The price compared to others is a little high but worth every penny, I wish I purchased them sooner. Connecting to TV is simple and easy. The batteries have outlasted my 5 hour marathons. They can also easily be swapped out once the start to wear down. The fit, They did feel a little tight when new but now they seem to have loosened up a bit and now feel comfortable. The are a little large so resting your head on a pillow could be a problem. Dropout, after months of use I did have dropout twice. My conclusion is that if the audio is corrupted or the audio feed drops below a certain level the headphone will not carry the bad audio and it sound like a dropout. I use a DVR and when replayed over the dropout reoccurs indicating it the sound feed and not the headphones. I prefer this over poor sound in the headset. Most people, while watching a TV show accept the video signal glitch from time to time but when the audio does it and your using headphone it becomes noticeable. As for the closed back design, I prefer the better isolation of background noise. If something loud happens in the house you will still hear it. The buttons for changing the volume would benefit from a better tactile felling. Maybe the + and - could be raised more than they are so they are easier to find. Be warned, this head set can be turned up very loud. if you have hearing problems these will do the job.

Review Contents: This is my second pair of wireless Sennheiser headphones. When it comes to wireless headphones, I have found Sennheiser to be a decent choice. I have paid less and gotten better sound, but the comfort, build quality, aesthetics, and longevity of the product are quite good. With that said, Sennheiser headphones suffer from the same difficulties all wireless headphones seem to suffer from: poor audio, periodic cutting out when walking around the room, interference from surrounding electronics at times, and battery issues.Here are the positives for these headphones:1. I purchased these because I want to listen to TV and music without waking up and/or bothering my partner. Thus, sound leakage is paramount. These headphones are excellent in regards to sound leakage. I can turn this up quite loudly and she can't hear a thing. 5/5 for the primary purpose!2. The headphones come with rechargeable batteries. The system for recharging (i.e. the stand) is intuitive. in that the batteries recharge effectively and last for many hours.3. The headphones are comfortable. They offer a slight squeeze, enough so they don't fall off, but not so much that they are uncomfortable. Basically, a perfect fit for my 7 1/2 sized head.4. The bass mode is excellent. The primary competitor for these headphones are Beats. I have a disdain for Beats due to the low quality build and sound they produce. Yet, when it comes to wireless they are the best I have heard. My partner has Beats so I have a proper point of comparison. These offer slightly BETTER bass addition than beats. Surprising, right?5. For television the headphones are good. I can hear everything fine. When it comes to music though...Negatives:1. The music quality is low. To be fair, my normal headphones are Sennheiser HD650s. So the point of comparison isn't really fair. But still, even my Boss IE2s, Sony MDR 750s, and even my Soul by Ludacris headphones supersede these in sound quality for music. The bass is so good that I can overlook some of the music shortcomings when listening to music that is best with huge amounts of bass...but for an audiophile-seeking individual this is a poor listening experience. I normally listen to classical music when working and more pop-type music when listening for fun and emailing I would never listen to classical music with these. I'll just get frustrated. This is for bass-heavy music only.2. The batteries are rechargeable and so far things seem to be going smoothly. BUT, my previous pair of Sennheisers had serious battery issues. I am not sure how long these will hold up.3. I am aware these are not Bluetooth. I wasn't seeking Bluetooth capabilities. But wireless is synonymous with Bluetooth to some people (i.e. my wife). Apple seems to be moving toward an elimination of the headphone jack on their iPhones. People will be seeking wireless headphones - and these are NOT it. These rely on a 3.5mm audio jack. Also, don't expect to make phone calls with these on. These are for TV purposes.Bottom Line: Good sound quality for TV and they have very little sound leakage. But, remember the sound quality will be poor.

Review Contents: I purchased 2 complete RS 165 systems.  Headphones and charging base.  Plan was to use these like my previous Sennheiser headsets, HDR 65, that we loved for years.  One base was used only for charging.  The other base had the auto plugged in.THIS DOES NOT WORK WITH THIS MODEL. The 2nd headset, the one that came with the 2nd  base, will NOT work with the first base, even if the headphones from the 1st base are off.  Just to cover all the options, I removed the 1st set completely (headset and base), installed the 2nd set (headset and base).  It worked perfectly.  Swapped bases. The 2nd headset stopped working and the 1st headset came back on.  I'm guessing these things are set to some arbitrary frequency at the factory, and only the stand alone extra headset that they sell can deal with finding the base frequency.  I'm unhappy and will return both, and shop around for a company with less deceptive advertising.  Lousy design.  I didn't mind paying extra for the 2nd complete set so that i could have convenient charging station, although a accessory charging station would have been a good selling point.  But they don't care.I suppose if your base ever failed, you'd be forced to buy a whole new system, and throw out your perfectly good headset.  A sad story.  Time to move on.Just a footnote:  Buying 2 complete systems (base and headset at $158 each) cost just $18 more than buying the alternative, one complete system (headset and base $158) and the awkward 2nd stand alone headset ($140).  But saving the $18 means you have to explain to the family time and again why they have to dismantle the spare headset frequently when someone forgets to follow the rotation schedule to swap headsets around on the single charging/base station.  Plus you still have to go buy a AAA battery charging station!!  We're talking an 8 hour per headset charging cycle time here.  What's the chance of getting this organized in order to be able manage 16 hours of charging time out of every 24 for two headsets ???  Very remote in my family.  ...And where are those spare batteries, by the way?  dah!And which family member is going to get the crappy "extra" headset that's always dead when you need it?  And where is that headset, by the way?  Not in it's logical docking station, so maybe it's under the couch, or in the garage, or the bathroom, who knows?  Spare yourself the grief...don't buy this product.Sennheiser has lost their way.  Again, time to move on.  Another once great company bites the dust!  So Sad.

Title: All about that bass

Review Contents: These headphones are a big step up from the Sony MDR-RF-985RK that I have for watching TV and movies when my family is asleep. My biggest concern was better sound and connection. Sennheiser definitely delivered here but came up short in the comfort department.As far as sound, they're terrific. Audiophile quality isn't practicable from a wireless set of headphones but this is really close. If you're looking for a new set of headphones to watch TV and movies that delivers awesome sound, these are probably it. They feature a bass boost option that is excellent because the bass is pretty weak without it enabled. The RF connection is also solid, and there is no static of clipping even when I move around. This is a huge improvement and the biggest reason I was willing to dish out the money for a new set. My Sony's had constant static and clipping which only got worse when I moved my head around.The one thing I'll miss about the Sony's is the comfort. I could wear them for hours and feel great. Not so with the Sennheisers. The weight distribution puts a lot of pressure not only on my ears (which I guess is great for isolating sound) but also on the top of my head. The padding on the headband is thin and stiff so I'm always aware of it. Also, they're massive. I know people call them "cans" but it's almost like having empty Campbell's containers on my head.Bottom line is if you value audio above comfort, these are for you. If the reverse, I'd try something else. Also if you're like me and couldn't decide between the 165, 175, or 185, wirecutter has a helpful review suggesting these over the 165. From several hours of research, I gathered that the surround sound feature on the 175 is a major disappointment which sounds hollow. It does have markedly better range though. It sounds like the improvement in audio quality of the 185's isn't enough to justify the price bump (I got a sealed, brand new pair with full warranty for $127 on ebay). Great pair of headphone that I would easily buy again. They might not be for everyone though.
